keqe_expansions: Nuts are edible seeds enclosed in a hard shell that grow on trees and are known for their nutritional value and versatility in cooking. They are packed with healthy fats, protein, vitamins, and minerals, making them a great snack option for boosting energy and promoting overall health. Nuts can be eaten raw or roasted and are commonly used in various dishes, desserts, and as toppings for salads. Some popular types of nuts include almonds, walnuts, pecans, cashews, and pistachios. Incorporating nuts into your diet can provide numerous health benefits, such as reducing the risk of heart disease, improving brain function, and aiding in weight management. Additionally, nuts are a convenient and portable snack that can be enjoyed on the go or as part of a well-balanced meal.

Nuts are edible seeds enclosed in a hard shell that are often considered a nutritious snack due to their high protein, healthy fats, vitamins, and minerals content. They come in a variety of types, such as almonds, walnuts, cashews, and pistachios, each with its own unique flavor and nutritional profile. Nuts are versatile and can be consumed on their own, added to dishes for extra crunch and flavor, or used in baking and cooking. Incorporating nuts into your diet may offer various health benefits, including supporting heart health, improving brain function, and aiding in weight management. Enjoying a handful of nuts as a snack or incorporating them into your meals can be a tasty and healthy way to boost your overall well-being.

top_passages: A review of the evidence: nuts and body weight.	There is currently no single dietary or lifestyle intervention that is effective in long-term weight loss. Traditional weight loss diets tend to be low in total fat and therefore often restrict nut consumption. However, nuts are an important source of many vitamins, minerals, monounsaturated and polyunsaturated fatty acids. This paper reviewed all the available evidence from the literature in relation to nut consumption and body weight.
